nl.strohalm.cyclos.dao
Interface FetchDAO

All Known Implementing Classes:
FetchDAOImpl
public interface FetchDAO

This componente provides mechanisms for lazy loading and fetching lazy relationships for persistent entities in the system. Implementors are free to provide such behavior in the prefered fashion. Using lazy loading and fetching only the relevant attributes of entities can be loaded, while secondary relationships may be only loaded on demand, providing an overall performance boost.

Author:
rafael, Ivan "Fireblade" Diana

Method Detail

clearCache

void clearCache()
Clears the first level entity cache

fetch

<E extends Entity> E fetch(E entity,
                           Relationship... fetch)
                       throws UnexpectedEntityException,
                              EntityNotFoundException,
                              DaoException
Fetches the given relationships for the given entity, if they are still not materialized. Implementors are free to provide such behavior in the prefered fashion. No guarantees are made about the instance returned being the same provided as parameter (situations can happen where the parameter is in fact a proxy or runtime-generated subclass).

If any exception is thrown by the underlying implementation, it should be wrapped by a DaoException.

Throws:
UnexpectedEntityException - When the entity is null or transient
EntityNotFoundException - When the given does not exists on the database
DaoException

isInitialized

boolean isInitialized(java.lang.Object value)
                      throws DaoException
Returns true if the given value is initialized. False otherwise. If any exception is thrown by the underlying implementation, it should be wrapped by a DaoException. If a transient object is provided as parameter returns true.

Throws:
DaoException

reload

<E extends Entity> E reload(E entity,
                            Relationship... fetch)
                        throws UnexpectedEntityException,
                               EntityNotFoundException,
                               DaoException
Fetches the given relationships for the given entity, forcing their state to be read from database . Implementors are free to provide such behavior in the prefered fashion. No guarantees are made about the instance returned being the same provided as parameter (situations can happen where the parameter is in fact a proxy or runtime-generated subclass).

If any exception is thrown by the underlying implementation, it should be wrapped by a DaoException.

Throws:
UnexpectedEntityException - When the entity is null or transient
EntityNotFoundException - When the given does not exists on the database
DaoException

removeFromCache

void removeFromCache(Entity entity)
Removes the given entity from entity cache
